name: company identification
description: checks that the filing clearly identifies the insurance company or other filing entity responsible for the submission.
prompt: requirement: the filing materials must clearly identify the insurance company or other filing entity responsible for the submission. to pass this check, the text you see must contain: (1) the full legal name of each insurance company or entity included in the filing; (2) for each such company, its 5-digit naic company code or another explicit unique company identifier labeled as a company code; and (3) at least one mailing or street address or city and state location for the primary company or group. if more than one company participates in the filing, each company must be listed with its own name and identifier. mark this requirement as failed if any of these elements are missing, incomplete, or only implied rather than stated explicitly.

name: filing jurisdiction and type
description: checks that the filing clearly states that it is a serff filing for new jersey and identifies the filing type.
prompt: requirement: the filing must unambiguously state that it is a serff filing for use in the state of new jersey and must identify the filing type. to pass this check, the text you see must contain: (1) at least one explicit reference to new jersey as the jurisdiction (for example, 'state of new jersey' or 'new jersey department of banking and insurance'); and (2) at least one explicit label or description of the filing type, such as 'rate filing', 'form filing', 'rule filing', 'rate and form filing', or similar. if the filing refers to multiple states, it must clearly indicate that this submission applies to new jersey and describe how new jersey is included. mark this requirement as failed if the jurisdiction or filing type is missing, ambiguous, or only inferable from context.

name: line of business and product identification
description: checks that the filing identifies the affected line of business and product or plan names.
prompt: requirement: the filing must identify the relevant line or lines of business and the product or plan names affected. to pass this check, the text you see must contain: (1) at least one explicit statement of the line of business or coverage type (for example, 'individual health', 'small employer health', 'homeowners', 'private passenger automobile', 'commercial package', etc.); and (2) at least one explicit product, policy, or plan name or series name that will appear in the marketplace. if multiple products are affected, the filing must either list each name or clearly describe the group of products covered. mark this requirement as failed if the line of business or the product/plan names are missing or too vague for a regulator to understand what business is being filed.

name: filing and tracking numbers
description: checks that the filing includes clear serff and company tracking identifiers.
prompt: requirement: the filing must include clear filing and tracking identifiers. to pass this check, the text you see must contain: (1) a serff tracking number explicitly labeled as such (for example, a line containing the word 'serff' followed by an alphanumeric tracking identifier); and (2) at least one company tracking, file, or control number explicitly labeled as a company or internal tracking number. if a single identifier is explicitly described as serving both serff and company tracking functions, that is acceptable. mark this requirement as failed if you cannot find any explicit serff tracking number or any explicit company tracking or file number.

name: effective and implementation dates
description: checks that the filing specifies clear effective dates for the proposed changes.
prompt: requirement: the filing must specify the effective date or dates for the proposed rates, forms, or rules. to pass this check, the text you see must contain at least one explicit calendar date (month, day, and year) that is clearly labeled as the effective date, implementation date, or date on and after which the filed changes apply. if the filing distinguishes between new and renewal business or between different segments, it must state the effective date for each segment it references. generic statements like 'effective upon approval' without any date do not satisfy this requirement. mark this requirement as failed if effective dates are missing, only implied, or described only in vague relative terms.

name: filing contact information
description: checks that the filing provides complete contact information for at least one responsible person.
prompt: requirement: the filing must provide complete contact information for at least one primary person responsible for the filing. to pass this check, the text you see must contain for at least one individual: (1) the person's full name; (2) their job title or role; (3) a direct telephone number; and (4) an email address. it is preferable, but not strictly required, that a mailing address is also provided. if more than one contact is shown, at least one must be clearly designated as the primary regulatory contact. mark this requirement as failed if no person is identified, or if any of the required contact elements (name, title, phone, email) are missing or unclear.

name: clear filing description
description: checks that the filing includes a clear and precise narrative description of what the filing does.
prompt: requirement: the filing must include a clear and precise narrative description of what the filing does. to pass this check, the text you see must contain at least one clearly identifiable section or paragraph (for example labeled 'filing description', 'purpose of filing', 'summary', or similar) that explains in plain language: (1) what types of materials are being filed (rates, rules, forms, or a combination); (2) whether the filing is introducing new material, revising existing material, or withdrawing material; and (3) the main purpose or reason for the change (for example, compliance with law, product redesign, rate level change). mark this requirement as failed if no such narrative exists or if the description is so vague that a regulator could not tell from it what is being changed and why.

name: document inventory
description: checks that the filing includes a complete list of all documents and attachments in the submission.
prompt: requirement: the filing must include a complete inventory of all documents and attachments included in the submission. to pass this check, the text you see must contain a list or table that clearly identifies each document in the filing package, such as cover letters, actuarial memoranda, rate tables, exhibits, supporting documentation, and policy forms or endorsements. for each listed item, the inventory must provide at least a document name or description and, where applicable, a form or document number and an edition or revision date. mark this requirement as failed if there is no such inventory, if obvious major documents are not included in the list, or if items are listed so vaguely that a regulator could not match the list to the actual attachments.

name: internal consistency of contents
description: checks that the filing description and the listed documents are consistent with each other.
prompt: requirement: the filing description and the document inventory must be internally consistent. to pass this check, you must verify that every major change described in the narrative (for example, adding or revising specific forms, coverages, or rating factors) has a corresponding document or attachment in the inventory or body of the filing, and that every major attachment referenced in the inventory is mentioned or logically accounted for in the description. if the description refers to documents, forms, or exhibits that do not appear anywhere else in the text you see, or if there are major attachments that are never explained, mark this requirement as failed.

name: page identifiers and pagination
description: checks that each document includes consistent identifiers, page numbers, and dates on every page.
prompt: requirement: each document in the filing must include consistent page-level identifiers and pagination. to pass this check, the text you see must show that, for each major document, every page includes at least: (1) a filing or document identifier, such as a serff tracking number and/or document or form name; (2) a page number that clearly indicates the page sequence (for example 'page 3 of 10' or 'page 3'); and (3) a date labeled as the date created or revised. in practice this information is often placed in a header or footer on every page. if you can see that these elements appear only on the first page or sporadically, or if key elements like page numbers or dates are missing, mark this requirement as failed.

name: revision handling and change identification
description: checks that revisions to previously filed material are clearly identified and dated, or that the filing is clearly labeled as entirely new.
prompt: requirement: if the filing revises previously filed material, the submission must clearly show what has changed and when. to pass this check, where the narrative indicates that existing rates, rules, or forms are being revised, the text you see must provide at least one of the following: (1) a marked-up or redlined version showing additions and deletions; (2) a change summary that itemizes the differences between the prior and proposed versions; or (3) another clear and systematic way of identifying the revised text. in addition, revised documents must show a current revision or edition date that matches the description. if the filing describes revisions but provides only clean pages with no change explanation or date information, mark this requirement as failed. if the filing clearly states that everything is entirely new and not a revision, this requirement is satisfied.

name: state-specific applicability
description: checks that the filing clearly states that the materials are intended for use in new jersey and explains how new jersey is treated if the program is multi-state.
prompt: requirement: the filing must clearly state that the rates, rules, and forms in the submission are intended for use in new jersey. to pass this check, the text you see must contain explicit language indicating that the filed materials apply to policies issued in the state of new jersey, for example phrases such as 'for use in the state of new jersey', 'for policies issued in new jersey', or similar wording. if the filing is part of a multi-state program, it must clearly describe how the new jersey version is defined (for example by separate forms, state-specific pages, or state-specific rate tables). mark this requirement as failed if new jersey is not mentioned at all, is only listed in a long list of states with no state-specific context, or if the scope of the filing with respect to new jersey is ambiguous.

name: compliance certification
description: checks that the filing includes at least one formal certification of compliance with new jersey requirements by an authorized person.
prompt: requirement: the filing must include at least one formal certification of compliance by an authorized person. to pass this check, the text you see must contain a signed or otherwise clearly attributed statement from an officer, actuary, or other authorized representative that: (1) identifies the person by name and title; and (2) states that the filing, including the attached rates, rules, and forms, complies with applicable laws and regulations of the state of new jersey and with the general filing instructions for new jersey. for rate filings, the certification should also state that the proposed rates are based on the supporting information provided and are not excessive, inadequate, or unfairly discriminatory, or use very similar regulatory language. mark this requirement as failed if there is no certification, if the certifying person's identity or title is missing, or if the statement does not clearly assert compliance with new jersey requirements.
